p: Because it is unlikely that PrEP will prove 100% efficacious, it is critical to understand the impact of PrEP on the immune response to HIV for individuals who become infected despite PrEP use. Possible delay in detection of HIV-1-infection as a result of PrEP use would be a concern if the recommended quarterly HIV testing missed diagnoses and inadvertently prolonged PrEP exposure after infection, thereby increasing risk of resistance mutations.
